questions.question: Which of the following is false about adjuvants in vaccines?

options.A: Immune response is increased by degree or duration by their use
options.B: They are used in HPV vaccines
options.C: There is a high incidence of side effects with their use
options.D: They help in the reduction of the amount of immunogens in vaccines

questions.explanation: Side effects are rare with the use of adjuvants in vaccines. Adjuvants are substances that are added to vaccines to enhance their immunogenicity by degree and/or duration. They help in the reduction of the amount of immunogen in vaccines or in the number of doses required to achieve immunity. Aluminium salts are the most commonly used adjuvants. Adjuvants are used in many vaccines like: Anthrax vaccine, Hep A vaccine, Hep B vaccine, Japanese encephalitis vaccine, DT and DTaP, HPV vaccine, and Pneumococcal vaccine.

questions.question: A child has come to you for the administration of the IPV vaccine, as part of his routineimmunisation schedule. Which of the following antibiotics may be found in this vaccine?
questions.explanation: IPV may contain trace amounts of streptomycin, neomycin or polymyxin B.MMR contain small amount of neomycin.Antibiotics are used during vaccine manufacture to prevent bacterial contamination of tissueculture cells.

questions.question: Which of the following are the most and least heat-sensitive vaccines respectively?

options.A: Sabin vaccine and Hep B vaccine
options.C: Japanese encephalitis vaccine and pneumococcal vaccine
options.D: Salk vaccine and Hep B vaccine

questions.explanation: Oral polio (Sabin) vaccine is the most heat-sensitive vaccine. Hepatitis B vaccines are the least heat-sensitive alongside meningococcal A vaccine, freeze-dried Hib vaccine, and pneumococcal vaccines.

questions.question: Which of the following vaccines should be protected from sub-zero temperatures?
questions.explanation: Hepatitis B vaccine is sensitive to freezing and should be protected from sub-zero temperatures. Vaccines to be protected from freezing are as follows: • Hepatitis B • Cholera • DTaP-hepB-Hib-IPV (hexavalent) • DTWP-hepB-Hib (pentavalent) • Liquid Hib • IPV • Influenza, pneumococcal vaccines • Tetanus, DT, Td • Rotavirus (freeze-dried, least sensitive), the liquid form is resistant to freezing • HPV

questions.question: What vaccines are supplied in the type of bottle given below?
questions.explanation: The image shows an amber-colored vial. Vaccines like BCG and measles vaccine are sensitive to light and thus are supplied in such vials.

questions.question: Which of the following is a non-electrical cold-chain equipment?
questions.explanation: Cold boxes, vaccine carriers, and ice packs are some of the non-electrical components of the cold-chain system. Cold boxes are insulated containers used for transportation and temporary storage of vaccines and ice packs. Vaccine carriers are usually not used for the storage of vaccines but for their transportation. Ice packs generally have two holes in them for placing vaccines. They are filled with water.

questions.question: What is the temperature maintained in the freezer compartment of the solar refrigeratorbattery drive?
questions.explanation: The freezer compartment of the solar refrigerator battery drive is maintained at -7 °C, and it isused to store mainly ice packs.The vaccine storage compartment of this solar cold chain equipment is maintained at 2 to 8°C. The other solar cold-chain equipment commonly used is the solar refrigerators direct drive,which uses the sun's energy to freeze phase-change materials like water and then uses this formed171ice bank to keep the refrigerator cold.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true about the device shown in the image below?

options.A: Smaller ones are given to PHCs and the larger ones to district vaccine stores
options.B: They have temperature zones for different vaccines
options.C: A kata thermometer is used to record temperature inside this device
options.D: These devices are provided with baskets to store vaccines

questions.explanation: The image shown in the question is of an ice-lined refrigerator (ILR). Dial or digital thermometers are used to record temperatures inside an ice-lined refrigerator. ILRs are the main method of vaccine storage in primary health centers. They are an important part of the cold chain and they maintain a temperature of 2 to 8 °C for the storage of vaccines. They have different temperature zones for different vaccines. The upper zone is for freeze-sensitive vaccines like cholera, Hep B, rotavirus (liquid), etc., while the lower zone is for heat-sensitive vaccines like OPV, measles, etc. All vaccines are kept in the basket provided with ILR. Vaccines like OPV, BCG, measles, and JE can be kept at the bottom of the basket, while DPT, TT, Hep B, IPV, and pentavalent vaccines and diluents are kept in the upper part of the basket.

questions.question: While working as a medical officer in a CHC, you experience a sudden power cut in your area due to which the ice-lined refrigerator loses power. What is the time taken for the temperature inside this equipment to rise to the maximum recommended temperature limit?
questions.explanation: Hold-over time is the time taken by cold-chain equipment to raise the temperature inside it, during loss of power, to the maximum temperature limit in its recommended range. For an ice-lined refrigerator (ILR), this time depends on: • Ambient temperature • Frequency of opening the equipment • Quantity of vaccines kept inside with spacing • Condition of ice-pack lining.

questions.question: At what level is the risk of cold-chain failure the highest?
questions.explanation: The risk of cold chain failure is highest at the sub-centre and village levels. Thus, vaccines are not stored at the sub-centre and are supplied on the day of use.

questions.question: Open vial policy is not applicable to which of the following vaccines?
questions.explanation: Open vial policy is not applicable for BCG and measles vaccines.It is applicable for:• DPT• TT• Hepatitis B vaccine•• OPV• Pentavalent vaccine• Rotavirus vaccine (New version with the VVM on the side)

questions.explanation: The image shown is of vaccine vial monitors (VVM), which measure the cumulative heat exposureof the vaccine.VVMs are heat-sensitive indicators that are routinely used to monitor vaccine viability as thevaccine vial moves across the supply chain. They record cumulative heat exposure througha gradual change in color. If the color of the inner square is the same or is darker than theouter circle, the vaccine has been exposed to too much heat and should be discarded.

questions.question: You are preparing to administer the BCG vaccine to a newborn at a PHC. Before administering the vaccine, you check the vaccine vial monitor. In which of the following observations on the VVM, will you discard the vaccine?

options.B: Inner square has the same color as the outer circle
options.C: Inner circle is lighter than the outer square
options.D: Inner square is darker than the outer circle

questions.explanation: A vaccine must be discarded if the VVM shows the inner square is the same color or darker than the outer circle.
